_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PTERODACTYL PANEL - PTERODACTYL.IO
name: AIOStreams
author: contact@patatje.dev
description: An egg to easily run the Stremio addon, AIOStreams, on a Pterodactyl panel.

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
# Install git
apt update
apt install -y git

# Update npm
npm install npm@latest -g

# Delete /mnt/server if it exists (e.g., from a previous installation)
if  [ -d "/mnt/server" ]; then
  rm -rf /mnt/server
fi

# Create the /mnt/server folder
mkdir -p /mnt/server

# Clone the project into /mnt/server
cd /mnt/server
git clone https://github.com/Viren070/AIOStreams.git .

# Install all node dependencies
npm install

# Build the project
npm run build

variables.name: Deterministic Addon ID
variables.description: Set to true to generate a deterministic addon ID based on the configuration, useful for apps like Vidi that require a different addon ID for multiple installations.

variables.name: Secret Key
variables.description:
The secret key used for encrypting the addon's configuration
You must use a 64 character hex string.

variables.name: Api Key
variables.description: The API key used to install and use the addon, leave empty to disable API key requirement.

variables.name: Show Die
variables.description: Controls whether the addon shows a dice emoji in its stream results.

variables.name: Log Level
variables.description: The log level of the addon.

variables.name: Log Format
variables.description: The log format of the addon.

variables.name: Log Sensitive Info
variables.description: Whether to log sensitive information like API keys.

variables.name: Addon Proxy
variables.description: The proxy URL to use for all requests made to upstream addons. You only need to configure this if the server you are hosting the addon on is blocked by Torrentio. e.g. http://warp:1080 from https://github.com/cmj2002/warp-docker.

variables.name: Addon Proxy Config
variables.description: Optionally, configure what domains to proxy. Use a comma separated list of rules in the format string:boolean. The later in the list, the higher the priority. You can use wildcards (*) to match multiple domains. e.g. "*:false,*.strem.fun:true". This would only proxy requests to the strem.fun domain and any subdomains of it.

variables.name: Max Addons
variables.description: The max number of addons that are allowed to be used through a single instance of the addon.

variables.name: Max Keyword Filters
variables.description: The maximum number of keyword filters that can be used in a single instance of the addon.

variables.name: Max Movie Size
variables.description: To control the maximum size the size filter sliders can go up to in bytes.

variables.name: Max Episode Size
variables.description: To control the maximum size the size filter sliders can go up to in bytes.

variables.name: Max Timeout
variables.description: The maximum timeout that can be set for an addon through the override option.

variables.name: Min Timeout
variables.description: The minimum timeout that can be set for an addon through the override option.

variables.name: MediaFlow IP Timeout
variables.description: The timeout for requesting the IP from MediaFlow. When we fail to get the IP from MediaFlow, no streams will be fetched and only an error message will be shown.

variables.name: Default MediaFlow URL
variables.description: If you set a default mediaflow configuration, it will force the addon to use MediaFlow for all instances. A user can override the mediaflow instance to use a different one.

variables.name: Default Timeout
variables.description: The default timeout for all requests. If other timeouts are not set, this will be used.

variables.name: Default Comet Timeout
variables.description: The default timeout for all requests to the Comet API. If left empty, either the DEFAULT_TIMEOUT or the overriden timeout will be used.

variables.name: Force Comet Hostname
variables.description: The following environment variable should only be set if you are using an internal URL for 'COMET_URL' e.g. http://comet:3000/ and want the comet streams to be accessible from outside the network. i.e. you would set these to the public URL of the comet instance.

variables.name: Force Comet Port
variables.description: The following environment variable should only be set if you are using an internal URL for 'COMET_URL' e.g. http://comet:3000/ and want the comet streams to be accessible from outside the network. i.e. you would set these to the public URL of the comet instance.

variables.name: Force Comet Protocol
variables.description: The following environment variable should only be set if you are using an internal URL for 'COMET_URL' e.g. http://comet:3000/ and want the comet streams to be accessible from outside the network. i.e. you would set these to the public URL of the comet instance.

variables.name: Default MediaFusion Timeout
variables.description: The default timeout for all requests to the MediaFusion API. If left empty, either the DEFAULT_TIMEOUT or the overriden timeout will be used.

variables.name: MediaFusion Config Timeout
variables.description: The timeout applied to the /encrypt-user-data endpoint of MediaFusion when auto generating the configuration.

variables.name: MediaFusion API Password
variables.description: If you are using a self hosted instance of MediaFusion protected with a 'API_PASSWORD', you must provide it here. If you want to be able to make use of the auto configuration. If you are planning on overriding the URL at the config page, you can leave this empty.

variables.name: Jackett URL
variables.description: If using a self hosted instance, provide the Jackett URL here.

variables.name: Jackett API Key
variables.description: If using a self hosted instance, provide the Jackett API key here.

variables.name: Stremio Jackett Cache Enabled
variables.description: Whether to enable the cache option for auto configurations.

variables.name: Default Stremio Jackett Timeout
variables.description: The default timeout for all requests to the Stremio Jackett API. If left empty, either the DEFAULT_TIMEOUT or the overriden timeout will be used.

variables.name: Default Easynews+ Timeout
variables.description: The default timeout for all requests to the Easynews+ API. If left empty, either the DEFAULT_TIMEOUT or the overriden timeout will be used.

variables.name: Default Torrentio Timeout
variables.description: The default timeout for all requests to the Torrentio API. If left empty, either the DEFAULT_TIMEOUT or the overriden timeout will be used.

variables.name: Default Orion Stremio Addon Timeout
variables.description: The default timeout for all requests to the Orion Stremio API. If left empty, either the DEFAULT_TIMEOUT or the overriden timeout will be used.

variables.name: Default Peerflix Timeout
variables.description: The default timeout for all requests to the Peerflix API. If left empty, either the DEFAULT_TIMEOUT or the overriden timeout will be used.

variables.name: Default TorBox Stremio Timeout
variables.description: The default timeout for all requests to the TorBox Stremio API. If left empty, either the DEFAULT_TIMEOUT or the overriden timeout will be used.

variables.name: Default Easynews Timeout
variables.description: The default timeout for all requests to the Easynews API. If left empty, either the DEFAULT_TIMEOUT or the overriden timeout will be used.

variables.name: Default Debridio Timeout
variables.description: The default timeout for all requests to the Debridio API. If left empty, either the DEFAULT_TIMEOUT or the overriden timeout will be used.

variables.name: Default DDM Cast Timeout
variables.description: The default timeout for all requests to the DDM Cast API. If left empty, either the DEFAULT_TIMEOUT or the overriden timeout will be used.

variables.name: Default Stremio GDrive Timeout
variables.description: The default timeout for all requests to the Stremio GDrive API. If left empty, either the DEFAULT_TIMEOUT or the overriden timeout will be used.

variables.name: Domain
variables.description: IGNORE if you are not using Traefik. The domain that the addon will be hosted on, e.g. aiostreams.example.com.

variables.name: Let's Encrypt Email
variables.description: IGNORE if you are not using Traefik. The email to use for Let's Encrypt.
